title: Jason Varitek is happy to be back with Red Sox on a new deal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jason Varitek signed a new contract to remain with the Boston Red Sox as a coach for the 2026 season.
Varitek has been with the Red Sox for 28 years, serving in various roles, including game-planning and run prevention coach.
Catchers like Carlos Narvaez have benefited from Varitek's coaching, with Narvaez throwing out 32 potential base stealers in 2025.

title: Patriots’ explosive rookie class breaks through at perfect time in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots rookies Kyle Williams and TreVeyon Henderson scored three touchdowns, contributing to a 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
Williams and Henderson accounted for 222 of New England's 435 total offensive yards, each recording significant 50-plus yard plays.
Rookie defenders Craig Woodson and Elijah Ponder also excelled, helping secure the Patriots' seventh consecutive win against Tampa.

title: Oddsmakers have Drake Maye as NFL MVP favorite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye is the current NFL MVP frontrunner, according to FanDuel with +250 odds.
Maye threw for 270 yards and two touchdowns in Patriots' win over the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
Maye is known for his dual-threat capabilities, amassing 2,555 passing yards and 283 rushing yards this season.

title: Rob Gronkowski announces that he will ‘retire as a Patriot’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rob Gronkowski will sign a one-day contract to retire with the New England Patriots.
Gronkowski played nine seasons with the Patriots, winning three Super Bowls and setting franchise records.
He will officially retire this week, marking the end of a storied NFL career with four Super Bowl wins.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Buccaneers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots secured a 28-23 victory over Tampa Bay with rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams delivering key touchdowns.
New England Patriots continued their winning streak to seven games, overcoming challenges with explosive plays by rookies and strong defense.
Drake Maye connected on deep plays despite a low completion rate, while Christian Gonzalez and tight ends struggled to make significant impacts.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ impressive road win over Buccaneers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots extend their win streak to seven after a 28-23 victory over the Buccaneers in Tampa.
Rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams scored three touchdowns, contributing 222 yards to New England's offense.
Patriots' defensive unit showed strength by forcing three consecutive punts after an early touchdown by the Buccaneers.

title: MBTA Transit Police officer facing drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into pole
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA Transit Police officer Jonathan Daveiga charged with drunk driving after allegedly crashing into a pole on Oct. 19.
Daveiga pleaded not guilty at his arraignment and was released on personal recognizance; he's on 'modified duty'.
Daveiga's next court appearance is scheduled for Dec. 19, following his refusal of a portable breathalyzer test.

title: Allston Car Wash employees still in federal custody after ICE raid
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nine employees from Allston Car Wash are in federal custody after a Nov. 4 ICE raid in Massachusetts.
ICE claims the detained workers either entered the U.S. illegally or overstayed visas, despite having work permits.
Detainees report mistreatment in custody; court orders filed to prevent out-of-state transfers amid legal proceedings.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Nikki Glaser hosted the Nov. 8 episode of 'Saturday Night Live,' with musical guest Sombr.
Glaser is known for her comedy rise after participating in the 2024 Tom Brady roast.
Highlights included Glaser's monologue, Sombr's performances, and Pete Davidson on 'Weekend Update.'

title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scored a key goal for the Boston Bruins against his former team, the Toronto Maple Leafs.
Minten's goal helped secure Boston's 4-3 victory, marking their sixth consecutive win in the 2025-26 season.
Minten was praised by coach Marco Sturm as the 'best player on the ice' during the postgame interview.
